name: <GITOPS-SECRET-NAME>
hint:
input the name of the k8s secret to access git server.
The secret will be created in k8s cluster at later point (during developer namespace config).
For now it is just name of the secret.
BUT you must record this name and use the exact same name to create secret.

name: <GIT_SERVER_HOST>
hint: Gitrepo host name. eg: github.com, bitbucket.org.

name: <GIT_SSH_PRIVATE_KEY>
hint: Content of the Git identity private key.

name: <GIT_SSH_PUBLIC_KEY>
hint: Content of the Git identity public key.

name: <GIT_SERVER_HOST_FILE>
hint: Content of the Git ssh known_hosts file.

name: <PVT_REGISTRY_SERVER>
hint:
the hostname of the registry server for cartographer used for supply chain. Examples:
DockerHub: index.docker.io 
Harbor: my-harbor.com/io, 
GCR: gcr.io 
ACR: azurecr.io

name: <PVT_REGISTRY_REPO>
hint:
the repository where workload images are stored in the registry. Images are written to SERVER-NAME/REPO-NAME/WL_NAME-WL_NAMESPACE. EG: 
DockerHub: dockerhub-username 
Harbor: my-project/supply-chain, 
GCR: my-project/supply-chain 
ACR: my-project/supply-chain

name: <DELIVERABLE_REPOSITORY_PREFIX>
hint:
the repository prefix where deliverable.yaml file will be written.
NOTE: this is a repository prefix (and not repository URL). eg: ssh://git@github.com:alinahid477
If you want to use full repository url use "spec.params.name=gitops_repository" and "spec.params.value=ssh://git@github.com/<username>/sourcecode.git" in workload.yaml instead.
Repository name will be appended as the same name as mentioned in the workload.yaml
Read details at: https://docs.vmware.com/en/Tanzu-Application-Platform/1.0/tap/GUID-scc-ootb-supply-chain-basic.html

name: <DELIVERABLE_REPOSITORY_BRANCH_NAME>
hint: the branch name of the deliverable reposity (where deliverable.yaml will be written by TAP). eg: release or main etc

name: <DELIVERABLE_REPOSITORY_USER_NAME>
hint: Username that TAP tekton will use to commit deliverable.yaml. eg: supplychain. This user does not necessarily need to exist as a user in git server (eg: github) as contributor of the repository. Just a name.

name: <DELIVERABLE_REPOSITORY_USER_EMAIL>
hint: Email address that TAP tekton will use to commit deliverable.yaml. eg: supplychain@cluster.local. This email does not necessarily need to exist or associated with a contributor of the repository.

name: <KP-DEFAULT-REPO>
hint:
Tanzu Build Service dependencies are written to this location
eg:my-harbor.io/my-project/build-service or my-dockerhub-user/build-service

name: <KP-DEFAULT-REPO-USERNAME>
hint:
is the username that can write to KP-DEFAULT-REPO.
You should be able to docker push to this location with this credential.

name: <INGRESS-DOMAIN>
hint:
This is the subdomain or domain for the host name that you point at the tanzu-shared-ingress service’s External IP address.
The (sub)domain A record does not need to be created upfront (and can be created later)
as the tanzu-shared-ingress service’s External IP address will become available after profile deployment.

name: <GIT-CATALOG-URL>
hint:
This is the URL of the catalog-info.yaml file from Tap GUI (that you downloaded from Tanzu Net, eg: Tanzu Application Platform GUI Blank Catalog) uploaded in your git repo.
 Steps to get the URL:
  - Download the tar file from Tanzu Net and untar.
  - Create a public github repo.
  - Push the contents of the untar in that repo.
  - get the url of the catalog-info.yaml (eg: https://github.com/alinahid477/tap-gui/blob/main/blank/catalog-info.yaml)

name: <SCANNER-DEV-NAMESPACE>
hint: This is the namespace where you want the ScanTemplates to be deployed to and scanning feature is going to run.

name: <TARGET-REGISTRY-CREDENTIALS-SECRET-NAME>
hint:
This is the name of the secret that contains the credentials to pull an image from the registry for scanning.
This secret is created when creatin developer namespace.
Use the value: registry-credential here.

name: <LEARNING-CENTER-DOMAIN-NAME>
hint:
This is the domain name for learing centre.
(eg: learningcenter.example.com).
The domain does not have to exist now.
It can be created later once the ip address is obtained
OR, it can be changed later through updating profile
for example: learningcenter.1.2.3.4.nip.io where 1.2.3.4 is the ip of tanzu-shared-ingress service’s External IP address.

name: <IS-APP-LIVE-VIEW-SSL-DISABLED>
hint: input true or false

name: <APP-LIVE-VIEW-INGRESS-DOMAIN>
hint:
This is the Domain for capturing live view data. This domain should match between run and view profile.
For run profile provide the domain name (and a suffix "appliveview". is already present in the file --> Merlin will take care of it).
On the View profile also provide the same domain name.

name: <TEST-VARIABLE>
hint: test test test

name: <AZ_LOCATION>
hint: eg: westus2

name: <AZ_GROUP_NAME>
hint: eg: tap

name: <AZ_AKS_CLUSTER_NAME>
hint: eg: tapcluster

name: <AZ_AKS_VM_SIZE>
hint: eg: Standard_D5_v2

name: <AZ_AKS_NODE_COUNT>
hint: eg: 4

name: <AZ_TENANT_ID>
hint: The subscription id

name: <AZ_APP_ID>
hint: The service principal app id

name: <AZ_APP_CLIENT_SECRET>
hint: The service principal app secret

name: <APP_TOOLKIT_CONTOUR_ENVOY_SERVICE_TYPE>
hint: Ingress controller service type. Possible values: [ClusterIP, LoadBalancer]

name: <APP_TOOLKIT_KNATIVE_DOMAIN_NAME>
hint: Domain name deligated for knative apps. EG: 127-0-0-1.sslip.io, apps.example.xyz etc

name: <APP_TOOLKIT_KPACK_DEFAULT_REGISTRY>
hint: Container registry domain-path for kpack. EG: docker.io/my-dockerhub-username/my-repo

name: <APP_TOOLKIT_KPACK_DEFAULT_REGISTRY_USERNAME>
hint: Username for the kpack default registry. EG: my-dockerhub-username

name: <APP_TOOLKIT_KPACK_DEFAULT_REGISTRY_PASSWORD>
hint: Password for the kpack default registry.

name: <KPACK_CLUSTERSTORE_NAME>
hint: name of the cluster store (eg: default)

name: <KPACK_CLUSTERSTORE_BUILDPACKS>
hint:
Type the urls for the buildpacks. Available buildpacks are:
	gcr.io/paketo-buildpacks/java
	gcr.io/paketo-buildpacks/nodejs
Press enter to add another. Once finished type 'end' end array input.

name: <KPACK_CLUSTERSTACK_NAME>
hint: name of the cluster stack. (eg: base)

name: <KPACK_CLUSTERSTACK_BUILD_IMAGE>
hint: Build image for the clusterstack. EG: paketobuildpacks/build:base-cnb

name: <KPACK_CLUSTERSTACK_RUN_IMAGE>
hint: Run image for the clusterstack. EG: paketobuildpacks/run:base-cnb

name: <KPACK_CLUSTERBUILDER_NAME>
hint: name of the cluster builder. (eg: default)

name: <KPACK_CLUSTERBUILDER_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_NAME>
hint: Service account (containing container registry and/or private github repo's secret) to be used by this builder. (eg: kpack-default-sa)

name: <KPACK_CLUSTERBUILDER_DOCKER_IMAGE_TAG>
hint:
The Kpack Builder itself will be an image. This is the image tag for the builder image. eg: your-dockerhub-username/defaultbuilder or gcr.io/your-project/defaultbuilder etc
This is different to image tag for the application container. The application image tag will be specified during creation of the image [kp image save tutorial-image --tag {IMAGE_TAG} --builder default].

name: <KPACK_CLUSTERSTACK_NAME>
hint: Name of the cluster stack. eg: base

name: <KPACK_CLUSTERSTORE_NAME>
hint: Name of the cluster store. eg: default

name: <KPACK_CLUSTERBUILDER_BUILDPACKS_ORDER>
hint:
The order of buildpacks by which the detection should occur.
For example: if you have mix of java and nodejs applications but the number of java applications are higher than nodejs you may want to put paketo-buildpacks/java before paketo-buildpacks/nodejs.
The buildpacks are from the cluster store previously created.
